trans-unit.source: Detailed walkthrough of using the Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration preview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Detailed walkthrough of using the Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration preview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory B2B supports your cross-company relationships by enabling business partners to selectively access your corporate applications
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory B2B supports your cross-company relationships by enabling business partners to selectively access your corporate applications

trans-unit.source: Detailed walkthrough of using the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2B collaboration preview
trans-unit.target: Detailed walkthrough of using the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2B collaboration preview

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough outlines how to use Azure AD B2B collaboration.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough outlines how to use Azure AD B2B collaboration.

trans-unit.source: As the IT administrator of Contoso, we want to share applications with employees from three partner companies.
trans-unit.target: As the IT administrator of Contoso, we want to share applications with employees from three partner companies.

trans-unit.source: None of the partner companies need to have Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: None of the partner companies need to have Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Alice from Simple Partner Org
trans-unit.target: Alice from Simple Partner Org

trans-unit.source: Bob, from Medium Partner Org, needs access to a set of apps
trans-unit.target: Bob, from Medium Partner Org, needs access to a set of apps

trans-unit.source: Carol, from Complex Partner Org, needs access to a set of apps, and membership in groups at Contoso
trans-unit.target: Carol, from Complex Partner Org, needs access to a set of apps, and membership in groups at Contoso

trans-unit.source: After invitations are sent out to partner users, we can configure them in Azure AD to grant access to apps and membership to groups through the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: After invitations are sent out to partner users, we can configure them in Azure AD to grant access to apps and membership to groups through the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Let's start by adding Alice.
trans-unit.target: Let's start by adding Alice.

trans-unit.source: Adding Alice to Contoso's directory
trans-unit.target: Adding Alice to Contoso's directory

trans-unit.source: Create a .csv file with the headers as shown, populating only Alice's **Email**, **DisplayName**, and **InviteContactUsUrl**.
trans-unit.target: Create a .csv file with the headers as shown, populating only Alice's **Email**, **DisplayName**, and **InviteContactUsUrl**.

trans-unit.source: **DisplayName** is the name that will appear in the invite, and also the name that will appear in Contoso's Azure AD directory.
trans-unit.target: **DisplayName** is the name that will appear in the invite, and also the name that will appear in Contoso's Azure AD directory.

trans-unit.source: **InviteContactUsUrl** is a way for Alice to contact Contoso.
trans-unit.target: **InviteContactUsUrl** is a way for Alice to contact Contoso.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, is specifies Contoso's LinkedIn profile.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, is specifies Contoso's LinkedIn profile.

trans-unit.source: It is important to have the labels in the first row of the .csv file in the same order and spelled the same way as shown.
trans-unit.target: It is important to have the labels in the first row of the .csv file in the same order and spelled the same way as shown.

trans-unit.source: See the CSV Format section below.
trans-unit.target: See the CSV Format section below.

trans-unit.source: ![Example CSV file for Alice](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/AliceCSV.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Example CSV file for Alice](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/AliceCSV.png)

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, add a user into the Contoso directory (Active Directory > Contoso > Users > Add User).
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, add a user into the Contoso directory (Active Directory > Contoso > Users > Add User).

trans-unit.source: In the "Type of User" drop down, select "Users in partner companies".
trans-unit.target: In the "Type of User" drop down, select "Users in partner companies".

trans-unit.source: Upload the .csv file.
trans-unit.target: Upload the .csv file.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the .csv file is closed prior to uploading.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the .csv file is closed prior to uploading.

trans-unit.source: CSV file upload for Alice
trans-unit.target: CSV file upload for Alice

trans-unit.source: Alice is now represented as an External User in Contoso's Azure AD directory.
trans-unit.target: Alice is now represented as an External User in Contoso's Azure AD directory.

trans-unit.source: Alice is listed in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Alice is listed in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: From Alice's point of view, she will receive the following email.
trans-unit.target: From Alice's point of view, she will receive the following email.

trans-unit.source: Invitation email for Alice
trans-unit.target: Invitation email for Alice

trans-unit.source: Alice clicks the link, and se is prompted to accept the invitation and to sign in using her work credentials.
trans-unit.target: Alice clicks the link, and se is prompted to accept the invitation and to sign in using her work credentials.

trans-unit.source: If Alice is not in the Azure AD directory, Alice will be prompted to sign up.
trans-unit.target: If Alice is not in the Azure AD directory, Alice will be prompted to sign up.

trans-unit.source: Sign up after invitation for Alice
trans-unit.target: Sign up after invitation for Alice

trans-unit.source: Alice is redirected to the App Access Panel, empty until she is granted access to apps.
trans-unit.target: Alice is redirected to the App Access Panel, empty until she is granted access to apps.

trans-unit.source: Access Panel for Alice
trans-unit.target: Access Panel for Alice

trans-unit.source: This is the simplest form of B2B collaboration.
trans-unit.target: This is the simplest form of B2B collaboration.

trans-unit.source: As a user in Contoso's Azure AD directory, Alice can be granted access to applications and groups through the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: As a user in Contoso's Azure AD directory, Alice can be granted access to applications and groups through the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Now let's add Bob, who needs access to the applications Moodle and Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: Now let's add Bob, who needs access to the applications Moodle and Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: Adding Bob to Contoso's directory and granting access to apps
trans-unit.target: Adding Bob to Contoso's directory and granting access to apps

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell with the Azure AD Module installed to find the application IDs of Moodle and Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell with the Azure AD Module installed to find the application IDs of Moodle and Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: The IDs can be retrieved using the cmdlet: `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId` This brings up a list of all available applications in Contoso and their AppPrincialIds.
trans-unit.target: The IDs can be retrieved using the cmdlet: `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId` This brings up a list of all available applications in Contoso and their AppPrincialIds.

trans-unit.source: ![Retrieve IDs for Bob](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/BobPowerShell.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Retrieve IDs for Bob](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/BobPowerShell.png)

trans-unit.source: Create .csv file, populating Bob's Email, DisplayName, **InviteAppID**, **InviteAppResources**, and InviteContactUsUrl.
trans-unit.target: Create .csv file, populating Bob's Email, DisplayName, **InviteAppID**, **InviteAppResources**, and InviteContactUsUrl.

trans-unit.source: **InviteAppResources** is populated with the AppPrincipalIds of Moodle and Salesforce found from PowerShell, separated by a space.
trans-unit.target: **InviteAppResources** is populated with the AppPrincipalIds of Moodle and Salesforce found from PowerShell, separated by a space.

trans-unit.source: This is highlighted by the green and blue boxed IDs which correspond to the PowerShell screenshot above.
trans-unit.target: This is highlighted by the green and blue boxed IDs which correspond to the PowerShell screenshot above.

trans-unit.source: **InviteAppId** is populated by the same AppPrincipalId of Moodle to brand the email and sign in pages.
trans-unit.target: **InviteAppId** is populated by the same AppPrincipalId of Moodle to brand the email and sign in pages.

trans-unit.source: ![Example CSV file for Bob](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/BobCSV.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Example CSV file for Bob](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/BobCSV.png)

trans-unit.source: Upload the .csv file through the Azure Portal just as it was done for Alice.
trans-unit.target: Upload the .csv file through the Azure Portal just as it was done for Alice.

trans-unit.source: Bob is now an external user in Contoso's Azure AD directory.
trans-unit.target: Bob is now an external user in Contoso's Azure AD directory.

trans-unit.source: Bob will receive the following email.
trans-unit.target: Bob will receive the following email.

trans-unit.source: Invitation email for Bob
trans-unit.target: Invitation email for Bob

trans-unit.source: Bob clicks the link and is prompted to accept the invitation.
trans-unit.target: Bob clicks the link and is prompted to accept the invitation.

trans-unit.source: After he is signed in, he is directed to the Access Panel and can already use Moodle and Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: After he is signed in, he is directed to the Access Panel and can already use Moodle and Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: Access Panel for Bob
trans-unit.target: Access Panel for Bob

trans-unit.source: We will add Carol next, who needs access to applications as well as membership to groups in Contoso's directory.
trans-unit.target: We will add Carol next, who needs access to applications as well as membership to groups in Contoso's directory.

trans-unit.source: Adding Carol to Contoso's directory, granting access to apps, and giving group membership
trans-unit.target: Adding Carol to Contoso's directory, granting access to apps, and giving group membership

trans-unit.source: Use Windows PowerShell with the Azure AD Module installed to find the application IDs and group IDs within Contoso.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows PowerShell with the Azure AD Module installed to find the application IDs and group IDs within Contoso.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve AppPrincipalId using cmdlet `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId`, same as for Bob
trans-unit.target: Retrieve AppPrincipalId using cmdlet `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId`, same as for Bob

trans-unit.source: Retrieve ObjectId for groups using cmdlet `Get-MsolGroup | fl DisplayName, ObjectId` This brings up a list of all groups in Contoso and their ObjectIds.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve ObjectId for groups using cmdlet `Get-MsolGroup | fl DisplayName, ObjectId` This brings up a list of all groups in Contoso and their ObjectIds.

trans-unit.source: Group IDs can also be retrieved as the Object ID in the Properties tab of the group in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Group IDs can also be retrieved as the Object ID in the Properties tab of the group in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: ![Retrieve IDs and groups for Carol](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/CarolPowerShell.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Retrieve IDs and groups for Carol](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/CarolPowerShell.png)

trans-unit.source: Create .csv file, populating Carol's Email, DisplayName, InviteAppID, InviteAppResources, **InviteGroupResources**, and InviteContactUsUrl.
trans-unit.target: Create .csv file, populating Carol's Email, DisplayName, InviteAppID, InviteAppResources, **InviteGroupResources**, and InviteContactUsUrl.

trans-unit.source: **InviteGroupResources** is populated by the ObjectIds of the groups MyGroup1 and Externals, separated by a space.
trans-unit.target: **InviteGroupResources** is populated by the ObjectIds of the groups MyGroup1 and Externals, separated by a space.

trans-unit.source: ![Example CSV file for Carol](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/CarolCSV.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Example CSV file for Carol](./media/active-directory-b2b-detailed-walkthrough/CarolCSV.png)

trans-unit.source: Upload the .csv file through the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Upload the .csv file through the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Carol is a user in Contoso's directory and is also a member of the groups MyGroup1 and Externals, as seen in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Carol is a user in Contoso's directory and is also a member of the groups MyGroup1 and Externals, as seen in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Carol is listed in a group in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Carol is listed in a group in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Carol will receive an email containing a link to accept the invitation.
trans-unit.target: Carol will receive an email containing a link to accept the invitation.

trans-unit.source: After she signs in, she will be redirected to the App Access Panel to have access to Moodle and Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: After she signs in, she will be redirected to the App Access Panel to have access to Moodle and Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: That's all there is to adding users from partner businesses in Azure AD B2B collaboration.
trans-unit.target: That's all there is to adding users from partner businesses in Azure AD B2B collaboration.

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough demonstrated adding Alice, Bob, and Carol in three separate .csv files, but they can in fact be added together in a single .csv file for simplicity.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough demonstrated adding Alice, Bob, and Carol in three separate .csv files, but they can in fact be added together in a single .csv file for simplicity.

trans-unit.source: Example CSV file for Alice, Bob, and Carol
trans-unit.target: Example CSV file for Alice, Bob, and Carol
